gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾ ਚਰਨ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰੁ ੲਿਕਾਂਗ ਲਿਖਿ ੳੂੜਾ ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ ਲਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aykankaaru Ikaang Likhi Oorhaa Aoankaaru Likhaaiaa.
translation: That homogenous supreme reality (God) ) first was written as numeral one mulmantr – the credal formula) and then He was inscribed as Ura syllable of Gurmukhi, further pronounced as Oankar.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਨਿਰਭੳੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਰਵੈਰੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satinaamu Karataa Purakhu Nirabhau Hoi Niravairu Sadaaiaa.
translation: Then He was called satinamu, the truth by name. Kartapurakh, the creator Lord, nirbhau, the fearless one, and Nirvair, withou rancour.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਾਲ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਪਰਤਖਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਅਜੂਨੀ ਸੈਭੰ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Akaal Moorati Paratakhi Hoi Naau Ajoonee Saibhan Bhaaiaa.
translation: Then emerging as the timeless akal murati to caIled as unborn and self-existent.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਪਰਸਾਦਿ ਸੁ ਅਾਦਿ ਸਚੁ ਜੁਗਹ ਜੁਗੰਤਰੁ ਹੋਂਦਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guraparasaadi Su Aadi Sachu Jougah Jougantari Hondaa Aaiaa.
translation: Realized through the grace of Guru, the divine preceptor, the current of this primeval truth (God) has continuously moving since before the beginning and throughout the Ages.

gurmukhi: ਹੈਭੀ ਹੋਸੀ ਸਚੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਸਚੁ ਦਰਸਣ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Haibhee Hosee Sachu Naau Sachu Darasanu Satiguroo Dikhaaiaa.
translation: He is verily the truth and will continue to be the truth for ever.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵਲੀਣੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਪਰਚਾ ਪਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabadu Surati Livaleenu Hoi Guru Chaylaa Parachaa Parachaaiaa.
translation: The true Guru has made available (for me) the glimpse of this truth.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੳੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guru Chaylaa Raharaasi Kari Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Charhhaaiaa.
translation: One who merging his iousness in the Word establishes a relationship of Guru and disciple, that disciple devoting himself to the Guru and progressing from worldliness attunes his consciousness in and with the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?1?
translation: The gurmukhs had the glimpse of imperceptible Lord who is the fruit of delights

gurmukhi: ੨ ਪੰਜ ਗੁਰੂ
translation: Five Gurus

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਪਾਰ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nirankaaru Akaaru Kari Aykankaaru Apaar Sadaaiaa.
translation: On assuming form that formless Lord was called as the boundless Ekankar.

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aoankaaru Akaaru Kari Iku Kavaau Pasaau Karaaiaa.
translation: Ekankar became Oankar whose one vibration spread as the creation.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜ ਤਤ ਪਰਵਾਣ ਕਰਿ ਪੰਜ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ ਪੰਜ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Panj Mitr Panj Satr Milaaiaa.
translation: Then were created the five elements and five friends (truth, contentment and compassion etc.) and five enemies (the five evil propensities) of the creatures.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜੇ ਤਿੰਨ ਅਸਾਧ ਸਾਧਿ ਸਾਧੁ ਸਦਾੲਿ ਸਾਧੁ ਬਿਰਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Panjay Tini Asaadh Saadhi Saadhu Sadaai Saadhu Biradaaiaa.
translation: Man harnessed the incurable ailments of five evil propensities and three qualities of nature and maintained his virtuous reputation of being a sadhu.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜੇ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਲਿਖਿ ਅਗੋਂ ਪਿਛੀਂ ਸਹਸ ਫਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Panjay Aykankaar Likhi Agon Pichheen Sahas Phalaaiaa.
translation: Five Gurus one after the other composed thousands of hymns, bat in praise of Ekankar.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜੇ ਅਖਰ ਪਰਧਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Panjay Akhar Paradhaan Kari Paramaysaru Hoi Naau Dharaaiaa.
translation: The bearer of fivelettered name, Nanak Dev, became prominent like God and was called Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇੳੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦ ਅੰਗਹੁਂ ੳੁਪਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Naanak Dayu Hai Guru Angadu Angahu Oupajaaiaa.
translation: These Guru are the true Guru Nanak Dev who created Guru Angad out of his own limbs.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਗਦ ਤੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਮਰਪਦ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Angad Tay Guru Amarapad Anmrit Raam Naamu Guru Bhaaiaa.
translation: From Guru Angad, Guru Amar Das, the attainer of immortal status of Guru and from him getting the nectar name of the Lord, Guru Ram Das was loved by the people.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮਦਾਸ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਰਜਣ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Raamadaas Guru Arajan Chhaaiaa ?2?
translation: From Guru Ram Das, like his shadow emerged Guru Arjan Dev

gurmukhi: ੩ ਗੁਰੂ ਹਰਿਗੋਬਿੰਦ
translation: Guru Hargobind Sahib

gurmukhi: ਦਸਤਗੀਰ ਹੁੲਿ ਪੰਜ ਪੀਰ ਹਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਹਰਿ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਅਤੋਲਾ
transliteration: Dasatageer Hui Panj Peer Hari Guru Hari Gobindu Atolaa.
translation: The first five Gurus held the hands of the people and the sixth Guru Hargobind is incomparable God-Guru.

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨ ਦੁਨੀ ਦਾ ਪਾਤਸਾਹ ਪਾਤਸਾਹਾਂ ਪਾਤਸਾਹ ਅਡੋਲਾ
transliteration: Deen Dounee Daa Paatisaahu Paatisaahaan Paatisaahu Adolaa.
translation: He is the king of spirituality as well as temporality and is in fact irremovable emperor of all the kings.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰਿ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਸਤਾਨ ਸੁਜਾਣ ਵਿਚੋਲਾ
transliteration: Panj Piaalay Ajaru Jari Hoi Masataan Sujaan Vicholaa.
translation: Assimilating the unbearable knowledge of the earlier five cups (Gurus) in the inner core of his mind he re,mains merry and wise mediator for humanity.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਰੀਅਾ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ਜਿਣਿ ਪਰਮਤਤੁ ਛਿਅ ਵਰਤਾਰੇ ਕੋਲੋ ਕੋਲਾ
transliteration: Tureeaa Charhhi Jini Paramatatu Chhia Varataaray Kolo Kolaa.
translation: In spite of the six philosophies spread around, he reaching the turiyä (highest stage of meditation) has attained the supreme reality.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਛਿਅ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀਅਾਂ ੲਿਕਸੁ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਗੋਲਾ
transliteration: Chhia Darasanu Chhia Peerhheeaan Ikasu Darasanu Andari Golaa.
translation: He has strung all the six philosophies and their sects in the strung of one philosophy.

gurmukhi: ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਸੰਤੋਖੀਅਾਂ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਵਿਰੋਲਾ
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Avataar Virolaa.
translation: He has churned the essence of the lives of celebate ascetics, the followers of truth, contented people, the siddhs and naths (yogis) and the (so called) incarnations of God.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਸੁਮੰਦ੍ਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੀਵੇ ਤਿਸੁ ਰਤਨ ਅਮੋਲਾ
transliteration: Giaarah Rudr Samound Vichi Mari Jeevai Tisu Ratanu Amolaa.
translation: All the eleven Rudrs remain in the ocean but those (divers) who seek life in death get the invaluable jewels.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਸੋਲਾਂ ਮੇਲ ਕਰਿ ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੳੁ ਹਿੰਡੋਲਾ
transliteration: Baarah Solaan Mayl Kari Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Hindolaa.
translation: All the twelve zodiac sings of sun, sixteen phases of moon and numerous constellations have provided a beautiful swing for him.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਰਜਾਮੀ ਬਾਲਾ ਭੋਲਾ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Antarajaamee Baalaa Bholaa ?3?
translation: This Guru is omniscient yet he possesses a childlike innocence.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਗੁਰੂ ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਮਹਿਮਾ
translation: The glory of the wash of the Guru feet

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਖੁਦਾੲਿ ਪੀਰ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Govindu Khudaai Peer Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoaa.
translation: Guru Hargobind is the Lord in the form of Guru. Earlier a disciple he is now a. Guru i.e. earlier Gurus and Guru Hargobind are the same.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਅਾਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਪਛੋਅਾ
transliteration: Nirankaar Aakaaru Kari Aykankaaru Akaaru Paloaa.
translation: First, the formless Lord assumed the form of the Ekarikar and later he created all the forms (i.e. universe).

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰੁ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਦਰੀਯਾੳੁ ਕਰੇਂਦੇ ਢੋਅਾ
transliteration: Aoankaari Akaari Lakh Lakh Dareeaau Karaynday Ddhoaa.
translation: In the form of Oatikär (Guru) lacs of streams of life take shelter.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਤ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਗੜਾੜ ਸਮੋਅਾ
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Samoundr Vichi Sat Samoundr Garhaarhi Samoaa.
translation: Lacs of rivers flow into seas, and all the seven seas merge in the oceans.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਗੜਾੜ ਕੜਾਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨਾ ਦਝਹਿ ਸੀਖ ਪਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Lakh Garhaarhi Karhaah Vichi Trisanaa Dajhahi Seekh Paroaa.
translation: In the cauldron of desires of fire, the creatures of lacs of oceans hooked in skewers are getting roasted.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨ ਬੂੰਦ ੲਿਕੁ ਠੰਢੇ ਤਤੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਖਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Baavan Chandan Boond Iku Tdaddhay Tatay Hoi Khaloaa.
translation: All these burning creatures attain peace by the one drop of sandal-delight of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਚਰੋਣਦਕ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Baavan Chandan Lakh Lakh Charan Kaval Charanodaku Hoaa.
translation: And lacs of such sandals have got created from the wash of the Guru's lotus feet.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਅਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Aloaa.
translation: By the order of the transcendent, primeaval perfect God, the canopy

gurmukhi: ਹਰਿਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਗੁਰ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਚੰਦੋਅਾ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Harigovind Gur Chhatr Chandoaa ?4?
translation: And the royal umbrella are held over the head of Guru Hargobind.

gurmukhi: ੫ ੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਮਹਾਂ ਪੁਰਖ
translation: Benevolent great men

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਦੇ ਘਰਿ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾ ਵੈਰੁ ਵਿਰੋਧੁ ੳੁਠਾਵੈ ਕੇਤੇ
transliteration: Sooraj Dai Ghari Chandramaa Vairu Virodhu Outdaavai Kaytai.
translation: When moon reaches the house of sun then (according to astrology) many enmities and oppositions erupt.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਅਾਵੈ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਘਰਿ ਵੈਰੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿ ਸਮਾਲੈ ਹੇਤੇ
transliteration: Sooraj Aavai Chandri Ghari Vairu Visaari Samaalai Haytai.
translation: And if sun enters the house of moon, the enmity is forgotten and love emerges.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਚਿਤਿ ਚੇਤੇ
transliteration: Jotee Joti Samaai Kai Pooran Param Joti Chiti Chaytai.
translation: The Gurmukh, having established his identity with the supreme light, always cherishes that flame in his heart.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਕ ਭੇਦ ਗੁਣੁ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਮਜਲਸ ਭੇਤੇ
transliteration: Lok Bhayd Gounu Giaanu Mili Piram Piaalaa Majalas Bhaytai.
translation: Understanding the mystery of the ways of the world, cultivating values and the knowledge of the Shastras, he quaffs the cup of love in the assembly (the holy congregation).

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤੀ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨਾ ੲਿਕੁ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਸਮੇਤੇ
transliteration: Chhia Routee Chhia Darasanaan Iku Sooraju Gur Giaanu Samaytai.
translation: As the six seasons are caused by one sun, similarly all the six philosophies are the result of the consolidated knowledge of the one Guru (the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਮਜਹਬ ਵਰਨ ਸਪਰਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤੁ ਸੁ ਖੇਤੇ
transliteration: Majahab Varan Saparasu Kari Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Su Khaytai.
translation: As eight metals mix to make one alloy, similarly meeting the Guru, all the vamas and sects turn out to be the followers of the way of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਘਰ ਥਾਪੇ ਨਵੈਂ ਅੰਗ ਦਸਮਾਂ ਸੁੰਨ ਲੰਘਾੲਿ ਅਗੇਤੇ
transliteration: Nau Ghar Daapay Navai Ang Dasamaan Sounn Laghaai Agaytai.
translation: Nine limbs form nine separate houses, but only the tenth gate of tranquillity, leads further to liberation.

gurmukhi: ਨੀਲ ਅਨੀਲ ਅਨਾਹਦੋ ਨਿਝਰੁ ਧਾਰਿ ਅਪਾਰ ਸਨੇਤੇ
transliteration: Neel Aneel Anaahado Nijharu Dhaari Apaar Sanaytai.
translation: Understanding the void (Sany), Jiv becomes infinite like the numbers of nil and anti and enjoys impossible water fall of His love.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਅਲੇਖ ਲੇਖ ਸੰਖ ਅਸੰਖ ਨ ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ
transliteration: Veer Ikeeh Alaykh Laykh Sankh Asankh N Satijougu Traytai.
translation: Then this jiv goes beyond the counts of twenty, twenty-one, millions or crores, innumerables, sad yugs, tretas yugs i.e. Jiv gets liberated from the time-cycle.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰ ਵਰਨ ਤੰਬੋਲ ਰਸ ਦੇਵ ਕਰੇਂਦਾ ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Tanbol Ras Dayv Karayndaa Pasoo Paraytai.
translation: As the four ingredients in a betel become beautiful and homogenous, similarly this benevolent Guru, transforms animals and ghosts into gods.

gurmukhi: ਫਕਰ ਦੇਸ ਕਿੳੁਂ ਮਿਲੈ ਦਮੇਤੇ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Dhakar Days Kioun Milai Damaytai ?5?
translation: How can this land of saintliness be procured by money and wealth.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਸੱਚ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ੳੁੱਚਾ
translation: Everything is below truth)

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਚਾਰਿ ਮਜਹਬ ਵਰਨ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਵਰਤੈ ਵਰਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Chaari Chaari Majahab Varan Chhia Darasan Varatai Varataaraa.
translation: The dealings of the four sects (of Muslims), four vamas (of Hindus) and the six schools of philosophy are current in the world.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਣਜ ਕਰਿ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਹਟ ਸਾਹ ਵਣਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee Vich Vanaj Kari Chaudah Hat Saahu Vanajaaraa.
translation: In all the shops of fourteen worlds, that great banker (the Lord God) is doing business in the form of Siva and Sakti, the all pervading cosmic law.

gurmukhi: ਸਚ ਵਣਜ ਗੁਰੁ ਹਟੀਅੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕੀਰਤਿ ਕਰਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sachu Vanaju Guru Hateeai Saadhasangati Keerati Karataaraa.
translation: The true merchandise is available in the Guru's shop, the holy congregation, wherein praises and glory of the Lord are sung.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨਸਿਮਰਨ ਸਦਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੳੁ ਸਬਦਬਿਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Sadaa Bhaau Bhagati Bhau Sabadi Bichaaraa.
translation: Knowledge, meditation, remembrance, loving devotion and the fear of the Lord are always propounded and discussed there.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਨਸਾਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਰਤਨ ਵਾਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirh Guramoukhi Pandu Ratan Vaapaaraa.
translation: Gurmukhs, who are steadfast in remembering the name of Lord, ablution and charity, make bargains of jewels (virtues) there.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਸਚਖੰਡਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Satiguroo Sach Khandi Vaasaa Nirankaaraa.
translation: The true Guru is benevolent and in his abode of truth, the formless Lord resides.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਸੋਧਿਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਸਚੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Chaudah Vidiaa Sodhi Kai Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sachu Piaaraa.
translation: Practising all the fourteen skills, the gurmukhs have identified love towards the truth as the fruit of all delights.

gurmukhi: ਸਚਹੁਂ ਓਰੈ ਸਭ ਕਿਛੁ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਚੁ ਅਾਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sachahu Aorai Sabh Kihu Oupari Guramoukhi Sachu Aachaaraa.
translation: Everything is below truth but, for the gurmukhs truthful conduct is higher than the truth.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਤਰੈ ਸੈਂਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Guru Oupadaysu Tarai Sainsaaraa.
translation: As the fragrance of sandal makes the whole vegetation fragrant, the whole world gets across through the teachings of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਪਿੳੁ ਪੀਅ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਹੁਸੀਅਾਰਾ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Apiu Peea Guramati Houseeaaraa ?6?
translation: Drinking the nectar of the Guru's teaching, the Jiv becomes awake and alert.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਵਿਚ ਗੁਰੂ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਹੈ
translation: Among the gurmukhs pervades the Guru

gurmukhi: ਅਮਲੀ ਸੋਫੀ ਚਾਕਰਾਂ ਅਾਪੁ ਅਾਪਣੇ ਲਾਗੇ ਬੰਨੇ
transliteration: Amalee Sodhee Chaakaraan Aapu Aapanay Laagay Bannai.
translation: Servants, addict as well as teetotaller, may be in the vicinity, but the minister

gurmukhi: ਮਹਰਮ ਹੋਹਿ ਵਜੀਰ ਸੋ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਮੂਲ ਨ ਮੰਨੇ
transliteration: Maharam Hoi Vajeer So Mantr Piaalaa Mooli N Mannai.
translation: Who knows ins and outs of the court never accepts their advice.

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਮਹਿਰਮ ਹੁਸਿਅਾਰ ਮਸਤ ਮਰਦਾਨੀ ਮਜਲਸ ਕਰਿ ਭੰਨੇ
transliteration: Naa Maharam Housiaar Masat Maradaanee Majalas Kari Bhannai.
translation: The ignorant one who tries to be clever or feigns indifference is expelled by the minister from the court.

gurmukhi: ਤਕਰੀਰੀ ਤਹਰੀਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੀਰ ਪਰਸਤ ਮੁਰੀਦ ੳੁਪੰਨੇ
transliteration: Takareeree Tahareer Vichi Peer Parasat Mureed Oupannai.
translation: In speaking and writing like this minister, loyal devoted disciples, have been created by the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਲਖੀਅੈ ਅਮਲੀ ਸੂਫੀ ਲਗੈ ਨ ਕੰਨੇ
transliteration: Guramati Alakhu N Lakheeai Amalee Soodhee Lagani Kannai.
translation: Those addicts, who have not had the glimpse of the Lord through the wisdom of the Guru, never associate with the teetotallers (the holy ones).

gurmukhi: ਅਮਲੀ ਜਾਣਨਿ ਅਮਲੀਅਾਂ ਸੋਫੀ ਜਾਣਨਿ ਸੋਫੀ ਵੰਨੇ
transliteration: Amalee Jaanani Amaleeaan Sodhee Jaanani Sodhee Vannai.
translation: The addicts are acquainted with addicts, likewise, teetotallers meet the teetotallers.

gurmukhi: ਹੇਤੁ ਵਜੀਰੈ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਦੁੲਿ ਖੋੜੀ ੲਿਕੁ ਜੀੳੁ ਸਿਧੰਨੇ
transliteration: Haytu Vajeerai Paatisaah Doi Khorhee Iku Jeeu Sidhannai.
translation: The affection between a king and his minister is such as if the same one life current is moving in two bodies.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਸਮਸੇਰ ਮਿਅਾਨ ਵਿਚਿ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਥੋਕੁ ਰਹਨ ਦੁੲਿ ਖੰਨੇ
transliteration: Jiu Samasayr Miaan Vichi Ikatu Dayku Rahani Dui Khannai.
translation: This relationship is also like the relation of the sword in the sheath; the two may be separate, yet they are one ( i.e. sword in sheath is yet called sword only).

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਜਿਵੈਂ ਰਸ ਗੰਨੇ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Jivain Rasu Gannai ?7?
translation: Likewise is the relation of gurmukhs with the Guru; they are subsumed in each other in such a manner as is the juice and the sugarcane.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਰਸੀੲੇ ਤੇ ਗ੍ਰਯਾਨੀ
translation: Devout gursikhs and vain scholars

gurmukhi: ਚਾਕਰ ਅਮਲੀ ਸੋਫੀਅਾਂ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਦੀ ਚੳੁਕੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chaakar Amalee Sodheeaan Paatisaah Dee Chaoukee Aaay.
translation: Servants, addict (of the Lord's name) as well as teetotallers devoid of Mitn came to the Lord king's presence.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਜਰ ਹਾਜਰਾਂ ਲਿਖੀਅਨਿ ਗੈਰ ਹਾਜਰਾਂ ਗੈਰ ਹਾਜਰ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Haajar Haajaraan Likheeani Gair Haajar Gairahaajar Laaay.
translation: Those present are marked present and those absent are declared absent.

gurmukhi: ਲਾੲਿਕ ਦੇ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ਕੈ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਮਜਲਸ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਦਾੲੇ
transliteration: Laaik Day Vichaari Kai Viralai Majalas Vichi Sadaaay.
translation: The intelligent king (God) selected a few to be his courtiers.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਹੁਸਿਅਾਰ ਮਸਤ ਖੁਸ ਫਹਿਮੀ ਦੋਵੇ ਪਰਚਾੲੇ
transliteration: Paatisaahu Housiaar Masat Khous Dhahimee Dovai Parachaaay.
translation: He, a clever person, made both the clever and the indifferent happy and put them to work.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਨਿ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਅਮਲੀਅਾਂ ਸੋਫੀ ਸਭ ਪਿਅਾਵਣ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dayni Piaalay Amaleeaan Sodhee Sabhi Peeaavanu Laaay.
translation: Now, the so called teetotallers (religious persons) were engaged to serve drinks (nam) to the addicts.

gurmukhi: ਮਤਵਾਲੇ ਅਮਲੀ ਹੁੲੇ ਪੀ ਪੀ ਚੜ੍ਹੇ ਸਹਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Matavaalay Amalee Hoay Pee Pee Charhhay Sahaji Ghari Aaay.
translation: The latter became exhilerated in the name of the Lord and attained tranquility

gurmukhi: ਸੂਫੀ ਮਾਰਨਿ ਟਕਰਾਂ ਪੂਜ ਨਿਵਾਜੇ ਸੀਸ ਨਿਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Soodhee Maarani Takaraan Pooj Nivaajai Sees Nivaaay.
translation: But the so-called religious persons (teetotallers who served mans to others) remained involved in the so-called prayer and ritualistic worship.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਅਜਾਬ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਖੁਦੀ ਬਹਸ ਬਹਸਾੲੇ
transliteration: Vayd Katayb Ajaab Vichi Kari Kari Khudee Bahas Bahasaaay.
translation: They under the tyranny of their religious books, the Vedas and the Katebas, kept busy in arrogant debates and discussions.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਪਾੲੇ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Viralaa Paaay ?8?
translation: Ny rare gurmukh attains the fruit of the delight (of quaffing the drink of Lord's name).

gurmukhi: ੯ ਰਸੀਅਾਂ ਨੇ ਗ੍ਰਯਾਨੀਅਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਦੇਣਾ ਤੇ ਗ੍ਰਯਾਨੀਅਾਂ ਦੀ ਨਾਂਹ
translation: The devout offer joy to the vain scholars but they do not accept it

gurmukhi: ਬਹੈ ਝਰੋਖੇ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਖਿੜਕੀ ਖੋਲ੍ਹਿ ਦੀਵਾਨ ਲਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bahai Jharokhay Paatisaah Khirhakee Kholhi Deevaan Lagaavai.
translation: The emperor (Lord) sitting in a window (holy congregation) gives audience to the people in a arranged court.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰਿ ਚੳੁਕੀ ਮਹਲ ਦੀ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਾ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Andari Chaoukee Mahal Dee Baahari Maradaanaa Mili Aavai.
translation: Inside gather the privileged persons but outside assemble the commoners.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਅੈ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਖਾਸਾਂ ਮਹਲਿ ਪਿਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Peeai Piaalaa Paatisaahu Andari Khaasaan Mahali Peelaavai.
translation: The Emperor (Lord) Himself quaffes the cup (of love) and arranges to serve the select ones inside.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵਨ ਅਮਲੀ ਸੂਫ਼ੀਅਾਂ ਅਵਲ ਦੋਮ ਦੇਖਿ ਦਿਖਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dayvani Amalee Soodheeaan Avali Dom Daykhi Dikhalaavai.
translation: Keeping in view the two categories of the likely addicts and the teetotallers (so-called religious persons) He Himself distributes the wine of love to them.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇ ਮਨਾਹ ਸਰਾਬ ਦੀ ਪੀਅੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਨ ਹੋਰੁ ਸੁਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karay Manaah Saraab Dee Peeai Aapu N Horu Soukhaavai.
translation: The teetotaller (engaged in ritualism) neither drinks the wine of love himself nor allows others to drink.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਸ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਮਿਹਰ ਕਰਿ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਦੇੲਿ ਨ ਪਛੋਤਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ulas Piaalaa Mihar Kari Viralay Dayi N Pachhotaavai.
translation: Getting pleased, that Lord goes on giving the cup of His grace to the rare ones and never regrets.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹੁ ਨ ਵਸਾਵੈ ਕਿਹੈ ਦਾ ਗੁਨਹ ਕਰਾੲਿ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਬਖਸਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kihu N Vasaavai Kihai Daa Gounah Karaai Houkamu Bakhasaavai.
translation: None is to blame, lie himself makes the creatures commit crime and himself pardons their sins in the hukam, the divine will.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰੁ ਨਾ ਜਾਣੈ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸ ਜਾਣੈ ਅਾਪ ਕੈ ਜਿਸੈ ਜਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Horu N Jaanai Piram Rasu Jaanai Aap Kai Jisu Janaavai.
translation: None else understands the mystery of the delight of His love; only He himself knows or the one whom He makes to know.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਰਲੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੈ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Viralay Guramoukhi Alakhu Lakhaavai ?9?
translation: Any rare gurmukh beholds the glimpse of that imperceptible Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਬੇਅਮਲੀਅਾਂ ਗ੍ਰਯਾਨੀਅਾਂ ਦਾ ਹਾਲ
translation: The condition of the non-addicts or hollow scholars

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਵਖਾਣਦੇ ਸੂਫੀ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Vayd Katayb Vakhaanaday Soodhee Hindoo Mousalamaanaa.
translation: Devoid of the love (of the Lord) Hindu and Muslim scholars describe the Vedas and the Katebas respectively.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣ ਖੁਦਾੲਿ ਦੇ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਹਰਿ ਪਰਮੇਸੁਰੁ ਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Mousalamaan Khudaai Day Hindoo Hari Paramaysuru Bhaanaa.
translation: Muslims are men of Allah and the Hindus love Hari (Visnu), the supreme god. Muslims have faith in Kalima, the sacred formula of Muslims, sunnat,

gurmukhi: ਕਲਮਾਂ ਸੁੰਨਤ ਸਿਦਕ ਧਰਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਜਨੇੳੂ ਤਿਲਕੁ ਸੁਖਾਣਾ
transliteration: Kalamaan Sounnat Sidak Dhari Paai Janayoo Tilaku Soukhaanaa.
translation: And circumcision, and Hindus feel comfortable with the flak, sandal paste mark and the sacred thread, janett

gurmukhi: ਮਕਾ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਦਾ ਗੰਗ ਬਨਾਰਸ ਦਾ ਹਿੰਦੁਵਾਣਾ
transliteration: Makaa Mousalamaan Daa Gang Banaaras Daa Hinduvaanaa.
translation: The pilgrimage centre of Muslims is Mecca and that of the Hindus Banaras situated on the bank of Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਜੇ ਰਖਿ ਨਿਮਾਜ ਕਰਿ ਪੂਜਾ ਵਰਤ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਹੈਰਾਣਾ
transliteration: Rojay Rakhi Nimaaj Kari Poojaa Varat Andari Hairaanaa.
translation: The former undertake rozas, fasts, and namaz, prayer, whereas the latter feel ecstasy (in their worship and fasts).

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਚਾਰਿ ਮਜਹਬ ਵਰਨ ਛਿਅ ਘਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਵਖਾਣਾ
transliteration: Chaari Chaari Majahab Varan Chhia Ghari Guru Oupadaysu Vakhaanaa.
translation: They each have four sects or castes. Hindus have their six philosophies which they preach in every home.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਪੀਰ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਲੋਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Mousalamaan Mureed Peer Guru Sikhee Hindoo Lobhaanaa.
translation: Muslims have the traditions of Murids and Pirs

gurmukhi: ਹਿੰਦੂ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣ ੲਿਕੋ ਰਹਿਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Hindoo Das Avataar Kari Mousalamaan Iko Rahimaanaa.
translation: Whereas the Hindus love to ten incarnations (of God), the Muslims have their single Khuda, Allah.

gurmukhi: ਖਿੰਜੋਤਾਣ ਕਰੇਨਿ ਧਿਙਾਣਾ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Khinjotaanu Karayni Dhiaanaa ?10?
translation: They both have in vain created many tensions.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਖਾਸ ਅਮਲੀ ਰਸੀਅਾਂ ਦਾ ਹਾਲ
translation: The condition of the special addicts

gurmukhi: ਅਮਲੀ ਖਾਸੇ ਮਜਲਸੀ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Amalee Khaasay Majalasee Piramu Piaalaa Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: The special admirers gathered in the assembly (holy congregation), through the cup of love have beholden the imperceptible (Lord).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਲਾ ਤਸਬੀ ਤੋੜਿ ਕੈ ਜਿੳੁਂ ਸੳੁ ਤਿਵੈਂ ਅਠੋਤਰੁ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Maalaa Tasabee Torhi Kai Jiu Sau Tivai Atdotaru Laaiaa.
translation: They break the restriction of beads (Muslim rosary) and for them the number of beads as hundred or one hundred and eight are immaterial.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਰੁ ੲਿਮਾਮ ਰਲਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਰਾਮੁ ਰਹੀਮੁ ਨ ਨਾੳੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mayru Imaamu Ralaai Kai Raamu Raheemu N Naaoun Ganaaiaa.
translation: They combine Meru (the last bead of Hindu rosary) and Imam (the last bead of Muslim roasary) and keep no distinction between Ram and Rahim (as names of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਦੁੲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਵਜੂਦੁ ਹੁੲਿ ਚੳੁਪੜ ਸਾਰੀ ਜੋੜਿ ਜੁੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dui Mili Iku Vajoodu Hui Chaouparh Saaree Jorhi Jurhaaiaa.
translation: Joining together they become one body and consider this world as the game of oblong dice.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਨੋ ਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Piram Piaalay Nij Ghari Aaiaa.
translation: Transcending the illusory phenomenon of the actions of Siva and his Sakti, they quaff the cup of love and stabilize in their own self.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਸੁ ਤਾਮਸੁ ਸਾਂਤਕੋ ਤੀਨੋ ਲੰਘਿ ਚੳੁਥਾ ਪਦੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raajasu Taamasu Saatako Teeno Laghi Chaudaa Padu Paaiaa.
translation: Going beyond the three qualities of nature, the rajas, tamas and sattv, they attain the fourth stage of supreme equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਖੁਦਾੲਿ ਪੀਰੁ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪੀਰੁ ਮੁਰੀਦੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Govind Khudaai Peeru Gurasikh Peeru Mureedu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Guru, Gobind and Khuda and Pir are all one, and the Sikhs of the Guru hold and know the inner truth of the Pir and Murid. i.e. the spiritual leader and the follower disciple.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਸਬਦ ਪਰਗਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਚੁ ਸਚੁ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachu Sabad Paragaasu Kari Sabadu Surati Sachu Sachi Milaaiaa.
translation: Enlightened by the true word and merging their consciousness in the Word they absorb their own truth into the supreme truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਚਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਸਚੁ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Sachaa Paatisaahu Sachu Bhaaiaa ?11?
translation: They love only the true emperor (Lord) and the truth.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਨਿਵਾਸ, ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਵਿਚ
translation: The abode of true Guru is the holy congregation ,

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਸੈ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Satiguru Saadhasangati Vichi Vasai.
translation: The true Guru is the transcendent perfect Brahm and resides in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਅਾਰਾਧੀਅੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਸਹਜ ਵਿਗਸੈ
transliteration: Sabadi Surati Araadheeai Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Sahaji Vigasai.
translation: By absorbing the consciousness in the Word He is adored, and cherishing love, devotion and His awe He spontaneously blooms in the heart.

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਓਹੁ ਮਰੈ ਨ ਸੋਗੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੇਂਦਾ ਰਹੈ ਨ ਭੋਗੁ ਵਿਣਸੈ
transliteration: Naa Aohu Marai N Sogu Hoi Dayndaa Rahai N Bhogu Vinasai.
translation: He never dies nor becomes sorrowful. He always goes on bestowing, and his bounties are never exhausted.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੂ ਸਮਾਣਾ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਹਸੈ
transliteration: Guroo Samaanaa Aakheeai Saadh Sangati Abinaasee Hasai.
translation: People say that the Guru has passed away but the holy congregation smilingly accepts Him as indestructible.

gurmukhi: ਛੇਵੀਂ ਪੀੜ੍ਹੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਦੀ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾਂ ਪੀੜੀ ਕੋ ਦਸੈ
transliteration: Chhayveen Peerhhee Guroo Dee Gur Sikhaa Peerhhee Ko Dasai.
translation: Guru (Hargobind) is the sixth generation of Gurus but who can tell about the generations of the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਨਾੳੁਂ ਸਚੁ ਦਰਸਨੋ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਸਰਸੈ
transliteration: Sachu Naaoun Sachu Darasano Sachakhand Satisangu Sarasai.
translation: The concepts of true name, true glimpse, and the true abode get their explanation only in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਭਗਤ ਵਛਲੁ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਪਰਸੈ
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Saadhasangi Bhagati Vachhalu Paarasu Parasai.
translation: The cup of love is quaffed in the holy congregation and there only the touch of the philosopher's stone (Lord), loving to devotees is received.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਅਾਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਕਾਲ ਅਜੋਨੀ ਜਸੈ
transliteration: Nirankaaru Akaaru Kari Hoi Akaal Ajonee Jasai.
translation: In the holy congregation, the formless one assumes form and there only the unborn, timeless

gurmukhi: ਸਚਾ ਸਚੁ ਕਸੳੁਟੀ ਕਸੈ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Sachaa Sachu Kasaoutee Kasai ?12?
translation: Being is eulogized. The truth only prevails there and everyone is tested on the touchstone of truth there.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ-ਸਚਖੰਡ ਹੈ
translation: Holy congregation is the abode of truth-

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਗੁਣ ਪੰਜ ਤਤ ੳੁਪਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aoankaar Akaaru Kari Trai Goun Panj Tat Oupajaaiaa.
translation: The supreme Reality assuming the form of Oankar created the three qualities (of matter) and the five elements.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸ ਸਾਜਿ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਚਲਿਤ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Saaji Das Avataar Chalit Varataaiaa.
translation: Creating Brahma, Visnu and Mahes'a he performed the sports of ten incarnations.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤਿ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਹ ਕਰਿ ਸਤ ਵਾਰ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ੳੁਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Kari Sati Vaar Sainsaar Oupaaiaa.
translation: Producing six seasons, twelve months and seven days he created the whole world.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਦੇ ਲੇਖ ਲਿਖਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਵੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਣ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Janam Maran Day Laykh Likhi Saasatr Vayd Puraan Sounaaiaa.
translation: Scribing the writs of birth and death, He recited the Vedas, Shastras and the Puranas.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਦਾ ਅਾਦਿ ਅੰਤ ਥਿਤ ਨ ਵਾਰੁ ਨ ਮਾਹੁ ਲਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Daa Aadi Antu Dit N Vaaru N Maahu Likhaaiaa.
translation: About the beginning and end of the holy congregation He did not prescribe any date, day or month.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚੁਖੰਡੁ ਹੈ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Sachu Khandu Hai Nirankaaru Guru Sabadu Vasaaiaa.
translation: Holy congregation is the abode of truth wherein resides the formless One in the form of Word.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਰਖਹੁਂ ਫਲ ਫਲ ਤੇ ਬਿਰਖ ਅਕਲ ਕਲਾ ਕਰਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Birakhahu Phalu Phal Tay Birakhu Akal Kalaa Kari Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Creating fruit from tree and tree from fruit i.e. making disciple of the Guru and then from disciple the Guru, the Lord has laid down the mystery of His perfect imperceptible form.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaiaa.
translation: The Gurus themselves bowed before the primeval Lord and made others also bow before Him.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰਖੁ ਪੁਰਾਤਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਓਤ ਪੋਤਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਸੂਤ੍ਰ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Purakhu Puraatanu Satiguroo Aotapoti Iku Sootr Banaaiaa.
translation: The true Guru is the primordial Lord who is pervading this creation as does a thread in the rosary.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਸਮਾਦੈ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Visamaadai Visamaadu Milaaiaa ?13?
translation: Guru Himself is the wonder who is one with the supreme wonder.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਬ੍ਹਮਾਂ ਕਰਤੱਵ
translation: Actions of Brahma

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮੇ ਦਿਤੇ ਵੇਦ ਚਾਰ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਅਾਸਰਮ ੳੁਪਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Brahamay Ditay Vayd Chaari Chaari Varan Aasaram Oupajaaay.
translation: Brahma gave four Vedas and created four vamas and four stages of life (brahmchary, grihasth, vanaprasth and sannyas).

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਛਿਅ ਸਾਸਤਾ ਛਿਅ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਭੇਸ ਵਰਤਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Chhia Saasataa Chhia Oupadays Bhays Varataaay.
translation: He created the six phi­losophies, their six texts. teachings and their corresponding sects.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਕੁੰਡਾਂ ਦੀਪ ਸਤ ਨੳੁ ਖੰਡ ਦਹਦਿਸਿ ਵੰਡ ਵੰਡਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chaaray Koundaan Deep Sat Nau Khand Dah Disi Vand Vandaaay.
translation: He dis­tributed the whole world into the four corners, seven continents, nine divi­sions and ten directions.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਥਲ ਵਣ ਖੰਡ ਪਰਬਤਾਂ ਤੀਰਥ ਦੇਵ ਸਥਾਨ ਬਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jal Dal Van Khand Parabataan Teerad Dayv Sadaan Banaaay.
translation: Water, earth, forests, mountains, pilgrimage cen­tres and the abodes of gods were created.

gurmukhi: ਜਪ ਤਪ ਸੰਜਮ ਹੋਮ ਜਗ ਕਰਮ ਧਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਦਾਨ ਕਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jap Tap Sanjam Hom Jag Karam Dharam Kari Daan Karaaay.
translation: He made the traditions of recitations, ascetic discipline, continence, burnt offerings, rituals, worships, char­ity etc.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੁ ਨ ਪਛਾਣਿਅਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਦਸੈ ਨ ਦਸਾੲੇ
transliteration: Nirankaaru N Pachhaaniaa Saadhasangati Dasai N Dasaaay.
translation: None has identified the formless Lord, because only holy congre­gation explains about the Lord but none goes there to ask about Him.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਅਾਖਣੁ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhi Sounaaay ?14?
translation: People talk and hear about Him only on the basis of heresay (no one moves on the way of experience).

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਵਿਸ਼ਨੂੰ ਕਰਤੱਵ
translation: Actions of Visnu

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰੀ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਵੈਰ ਵਿਰੋਧ ਜੋਧ ਲੜਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Das Avataaree Bisanu Hoi Vair Virodh Jodh Larhavaaay.
translation: In his ten incarnations Visnu caused the opposing warriors fight each other.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵ ਦਾਨਵ ਕਰਿ ਦੁੲਿ ਧੜੇ ਦੈਤ ਹਰਾੲੇ ਦੇਵ ਜਿਤਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dayv Daanav Kari Dui Dharhay Dait Haraaay Dayv Jinaaay.
translation: He created two factions of gods and demons and out of them he helped the gods win and caused the defeat of demons.

gurmukhi: ਮਛ ਕਛ ਵੈਰਾਹ ਰੂਪ ਨਰਸਿੰਘ ਬਾਵਨ ਬੋਧ ੳੁਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Machh Kachh Vairaah Roop Nar Singh Baavan Baudh Oupaaay.
translation: He created incarnations in the forms of Fish, Tortoise, Varah (Boar), Narsingh (Man-lion), Vaman (Dwarf) and the Buddh.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਸਰਾਮ ਰਾਮ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕਿਲਕ ਕਲੰਕੀ ਨਾੳੁ ਗਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Parasaraamu Raam Krisanu Hoi Kilak Kalakee Naau Ganaaay.
translation: The names of Pars'u Ram, Ram, Krsna, Kalki are also counted among his incarnations.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਚਲ ਚਲਿਤ ਪਖੰਡ ਬਹੁ ਵਲ ਛਲਕਰਿ ਪਰਪੰਚ ਵਧਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chanchal Chalit Pakhand Bahu Val Chhal Kari Parapanch Vadhaaay.
translation: Through their deceptive and frolicsome characters, they increased delusions, deceits and convolutions.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਨਿਰਭੳੁ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਨ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Nirabhau Nirankaaru N Dikhaaay.
translation: Nothing was done to have the glimpse of fearless, formless, transcendent, perfect Brahm. Ksatriyas were annihilated

gurmukhi: ਖਤ੍ਰੀ ਮਾਰਿ ਸੰਘਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਮਾਯਣ ਮਹਾਭਾਰਤ ਭਾੲੇ
transliteration: Khatree Maari Sanghaaru Kari Raamaayan Mahaabhaarat Bhaaay.
translation: And the Ramayan and the Mahabharat epics were composed to please the people.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕਰੋਧੁ ਨ ਮਾਰਿਓ ਲੋਭੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੁ ਨ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kaam Karodhu N Maariao Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru N Jaaay.
translation: Lust and anger were not deci­mated, nor greed,infatuation and ego were wiped out.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਣੁ ਜਨਮ ਗਵਾੲੇ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Vinu Janamu Gavaaay ?15?
translation: Without the holy congregation, the human birth was lost in vain.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਸ਼ਿਵ ਕਰਤੱਵ
translation: Actions of Siva

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਦੂੰ ਗਿਅਾਰਹ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਹੋੲਿ ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਅੳੁਧੂਤੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ikadoo Giaarah Rudr Hoi Gharabaaree Audhootu Sadaaiaa.
translation: From one there became eleven Rudrs (Sivas).Even being a householder he was called a recluse.

gurmukhi: ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਸੰਤੋਖੀਅਾ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਕਰਿ ਪਰਚਾ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Kari Parachaa Laaiaa.
translation: He loved celebates, followers of truth, contented ones, Siddhs (the proven ones) and naths, controllers of senses.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀ ਦਸ ਨਾਵ ਧਰਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sanniaasee Das Naanv Dhari Jogee Baarah Pand Chalaaiaa.
translation: Sannyasis adopted ten names and yogis also promulgated their twelve sects.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਰਸਾੲਿਣਾਂ ਤੰਤ ਮੰਤ ਚੇਟਕ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Rasaainaan Tant Mant Chaytak Varataaiaa.
translation: Riddhi, siddhis (miraculous powers), treasures, rasciree (chemical elixir), tantra, mantra and conjurations were introduced.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਲਾ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਵਰਾਤ ਦਾ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਾਦੁ ਵਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Maylaa Kari Sivaraat Daa Karaamaat Vichi Vaadu Vadhaaiaa.
translation: Sivaratri was celebrated as a fair and it increased the debates and the use of miraculous powers.

gurmukhi: ਪੋਸਤ ਭੰਗ ਸਰਾਬ ਦਾ ਚਲੈ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਭੁਗਤ ਭੁੰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Posat Bhang Saraab Daa Chalai Piaalaa Bhougat Bhounchaaiaa.
translation: The cups of hemp, opium and wine were consumed and enjoyed.

gurmukhi: ਵਜਨਿ ਬੁਰਗੂ ਸਿੰਙੀਅਾਂ ਸੰਖ ਨਾਦ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Vajani Buragoo Sineeaan Sankh Naad Raharaasi Karaaiaa.
translation: Rules for blowing instruments, like singe - and the conch were set.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਜਗਾੲਿਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Alakhu Jagaain Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: The primal Lord was saluted and invoked with the shouts of Alakh (the Imperceptible) but no one had perceived the Alakh.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਣ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vinu Bharami Bhulaaiaa ?16?
translation: Without holy congregation all remained duped by delusions.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਸਚੀ ਰਹੁਰੀਤ ਮੁਕਤ ਮਾਰਗ
translation: The true conduct as way to liberation

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਅਾਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਗੁਰਾਂ ਗੁਰੂ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Kari Satiguru Guraan Guroo Abinaasee.
translation: The formless One has assumed form as the true Guru (Nanak Dev) who is the eternal Guru of the Gurus.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰਾਂ ਪੀਰ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਨਾਥਾਂ ਨਾਥ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Peeraan Peeru Vakhaaneeai Naadaan Naadu Saadhasangi Vaasee.
translation: He is known as the pir of pirs(Muslim spiritualists) and that Master of masters resides in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaa Gurasikhu Maaiaa Vichi Udaasee.
translation: He promulgated gurmukh panth, the way of Gurmukhs, and the Sikhs of the Guru remain detached even in maya.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪੰਚ ਅਾਖੀਅਨਿ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਪੰਚ ਪਰਮੇਸੁਰ ਪਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhi Mili Panch Aakheeani Biradu Panch Paramaysuru Paasee.
translation: Those present themselves before the Guru are known as panches (the eminent ones) and the reputation of such panches  is protected by the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਰਵਾਣ ਪੰਚ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਬਿਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Mili Paravaan Panch Saadhasangati Sach Khand Bilaasee.
translation: Meeting the Gurmukhs such panches  get accepted and move happily in the holy congregation, the abode of truth.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਹੈ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਰਹਰਾਸੀ
transliteration: Gur Darasan Gurasabad Hai Nij Ghari Bhaai Bhagati Raharaasee.
translation: The word of the Guru is the glimpse of the Guru and getting settled in one's own self, the discipline of loving devotion is observed.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਨਿਵ ਚਲਣੁ ਖਟਿ ਖਵਾਲਣੁ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸੀ
transliteration: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Khati Khavaalanu Aas Niraasee.
translation: This discipline consists in sweet speech, humble conduct, honest labour, hospitality and in remaining detached among hopes and disappointments.

gurmukhi: ਸਦਾ ਸਹਜਿ ਬੈਰਾਗੁ ਹੈ ਕਲੀ ਕਾਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sadaa Sahaju Bairaagu Hai Kalee Kaal Andari Paragaasee.
translation: Living in equi­poise and indifference is true renunciation in the Kaliyug, the dark age.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਬੰਦ ਖਲਾਸੀ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Band Khalaasee ?17?
translation: Meeting the holy congregation only, one gets liberated from the cycle of transmigration

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਪੀਹੜੀ
translation: The Gurmukh generation

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰੀ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਪੁਰਖ ਪਿਅਾਰ ਕਰੇਂਦੇ ਨਾਰੀ
transliteration: Naaree Purakhu Piaaru Hai Purakhu Piaar Karayndaa Naaree.
translation: Woman loves man and man also loves his woman (wife).

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਿ ਭਤਾਰੁ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਮਿਲਿ ਪੁਤ ਸੁਪੁਤੁ ਕੁਪੁਤੁ ਸੈਂਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Naari Bhataaru Sanjog Mili Pout Soupoutu Koupoutu Sainsaaree.
translation: By the union of husband and wife, in this world sons, worthy and unworthy are born.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰਖ ਪੁਰਖਾਂ ਜੋ ਰਚਨਿ ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Purakh Purakhaan Jo Rachani Tay Viralay Niramal Nirankaaree.
translation: Those who remain absorbed in the Lord God, the male of all the males, are rare pure ones.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰਖਹੁਂ ਪੁਰਖ ੳੁਪਜਦਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਤੇ ਚੇਲਾ ਸਬਦ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Purakhahu Purakh Oupajadaa Guru Tay Chaylaa Sabad Veechaaree.
translation: From the primeval Lord, the male (the creative principle) is produced in the same way as by reflection, upon the Word, the true disciple of the Guru is created.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਹੋਅਾ ਪਾਰਸਹੁਂ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਣਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Paaras Hoaa Paarasahu Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Gounakaaree.
translation: Philosopher's stone produces another philosopher's stone i.e. from Guru emerges disciple and the same disciple eventually becomes a virtuous Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵੰਸੀ ਪਰਮਹੰਸੁ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਾਧ ਸੇ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Vansee Paramahansu Gurasikh Saadh Say Paraoupakaaree.
translation: The gurmukhs belong to the lineage of the super swans i.e. they are most sacred. The Sikhs of Guru are benevolent like sadhus.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਸਾਕ ਸਚਾ ਗੁਰ ਵਾਕ ਜੁਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Gurabhaaee Gurabhaaeeaan Saak Sachaa Gur Vaak Juhaaree.
translation: The Guru's disciple keeps fraternal relationship with fellow disci­ples and they salute one another with the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਤਨੁ ਪਰ ਧਨੁ ਪਰਹਰੇ ਪਰ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਪਰਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Par Tanu Par Dhanu Paraharay Par Nidaa Haoumai Parahaaree.
translation: They have renounced other's body, other's wealth, slander and ego.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਟਹੁਂ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Vitahu Balihaaree ?18?
translation: I am sacrifice unto such holy congregation (which brings about such transformation).

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਾਕ ਸੱਚਾ ਸਾਕ ਹੈ
translation: Relationship of the discipleshipof the Guru is the true relation

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪਿਅਾਰ
translation: Relationship of the discipleshipof the Guru is the true relation

gurmukhi: ਪਿੳੁ ਦਾਦਾ ਪੜਦਾਦਿਓਂ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਪੋਤਾ ਪੜਪੋਤਾ ਨਤਾ
transliteration: Piu Daadaa Parhadaadiahu Pout Potaa Parhapotaa Nataa.
translation: From father, grand father, great grand father are born son, grand son,great grand son respectively and from great grand son is born simply a relative (natte, having no specific relational name).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਦਾਦੀ ਪੜਦਾਦੀਓਂ ਫੁਫੀ ਭੈਣ ਧੀਅਾਂ ਸਣਖਤਾ
transliteration: Maan Daadee Parhadaadeeahu Phuphee Bhain Dheea Sanakhataa.
translation: The relationship of mother, grand mother, greatgrand mother, father's sister, sister, daughter, and daughter-in-law is also respected.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨਾ ਨਾਨੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਪੜਨਾਨਾ ਪੜਨਾਨੀ ਪਤਾ
transliteration: Naanaa Naanee Aakheeai Parhanaanaa Parhanaanee Pataa.
translation: Maternal grand father and mother and maternal great grand father and mother are also known.

gurmukhi: ਤਾੲਿਅਾ ਚਾਚਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਤਾੲੀ ਚਾਚੀ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਤਾ
transliteration: Taaiaa Chaachaa Jaaneeai Taaee Chaachee Maaiaa Mataa.
translation: Father's elder brother (Taiya) younger brother (chachc7a, their wives (tayi, chachi)et al. also remain absorbed in wordly affairs (maya).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਮੇ ਤੈ ਮਾਮਣੀਅਾਂ ਮਾਸੀ ਮਾਸੜ ਦੇ ਰੰਗ ਰਤਾ
transliteration: Maamay Tai Maamaaneeaan Maasee Maasarh Dai Rang Rataa.
translation: Mama, mann- (mother's brother and his wife), mast; masa"; (mother's sister and her husband), all look dyed in their own colours.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਸੜ ਫੁਫੜ ਸਾਕ ਸਭ ਸਹੁਰਾ ਸਸ ਸਾਲੀ ਸਾਲਤਾ
transliteration: Maasarh Phupharh Saak Sabh Sahuraa Sas Saalee Saalataa.
translation: Masar, phuphet (mother's sister's husband and father's sister's husband respectively), father-in-law, mother-in-law, sister-in-law (sali) and brother-in-law (sala) are also close.

gurmukhi: ਤਾੲੇਰ ਪਿਤੀੲੇਰ ਮੇਲੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਮੳੁਲੇਰ ਫੁਫੇਰ ਅਵਤਾ
transliteration: Taaayr Piteeayr Maylu Mili Maulayr Phuphayr Avataa.
translation: The relationship of chacha's-in-law and those of the mama-in-law and phaphd-in-law are known as inconvenient relations.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਂਢੂ ਕੁੜਮ ਕੁਟੰਬ ਸਭ ਨਦੀ ਨਾਵ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਨਿਸਤਾ
transliteration: Saaddhoo Kurhamu Koutanb Sabh Nadee Naav Sanjog Nisataa.
translation: The relation­ship of sister-in-law's husband (Sandhi) and father-in-law of your daughter or son (Kuram) are momentary and fake like those passengers of a boat sitting in a group.

gurmukhi: ਸਚਾ ਸਾਕੁ ਨਾ ਵਿਛੜੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਭਾੲੀ ਭਤਾ
transliteration: Sachaa Saak N Vichharhai Saadhasangati Gur Bhaaee Bhataa.
translation: The true relationship is with those brothers who meet in the holy congregation.They never get separated.

gurmukhi: ਭੋਗ ਭੁਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੋਗ ਜੁਗਤਾ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Bhog Bhougati Vichi Jog Jougataa ?19?
translation: Through the holy congrega­tion, the gurmukhs learn the technique of renunciation amidst enjoyments.

gurmukhi: ਪੀੳੁ ਦੇ ਨਾਂਹ ਪਿਅਾਰ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਫੁਫੀ ਨ ਪਿਤੀੲੇ ਤਾੲੇ
transliteration: Peeu Day Naanh Piaar Tuli Naa Dhudhee Naa Piteeay Taaay.
translation: The love of father's sister or cousins are not equal to the father's love.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੳੂ ਹੇਤੁ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਹੇਤੁ ਨ ਮਾਮੇ ਮਾਸੀ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Maaoo Haytu N Pujanee Haytu N Maamay Maasee Jaaay.
translation: Love of mother cannot be equalled by the love of the children of maternal uncle and mother's sister.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਬਾਂ ਸਧਰ ਨਾ ਲਹੈ ਅਾਣ ਅੰਬਾਕੜੀਅਾਂ ਜੇ ਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Anbaan Sadhar N Outarai Aani Anbaakarheeaan Jay Khaaay.
translation: By eating mango blossms the desire for eating mangoes is not fulfilled.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਲੀ ਪਾਨ ਪਟੰਤਰਾ ਵਾਸੁ ਡਕਾਰ ਪਰਗਟੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Moolee Paan Patantaraa Vaasu Dikaaru Paragateeaaay.
translation: The smells of radish leaves and betel are differ­ent and are identified through smell and eructation.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਚੰਦ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਦੀਵੇ ਲਖ ਤਾਰੇ ਚਮਕਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sooraj Chand N Pujanee Deevay Lakh Taaray Chamakaaay.
translation: Lacs of lighted lamps and stars cannot compete with the sun and the moon.

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਮਜੀਠ ਕੁਸੁੰਭ ਦਾ ਸਦਾ ਸਥੋੲੀ ਵੇਸ ਵਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Rang Majeetd Kousounbh Daa Sadaa Sadoee Vaysu Vataaay.
translation: The colour of madder is steadfast and the colour of safflower changes very soon.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਮਿਹਰਵਾਨ ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਨ ਦੇਵ ਸਬਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Tuli N Miharavaan Maat Pitaa N Dayv Sabaaay.
translation: Neither mother and father nor all the gods can be as gracious as the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਡਿਠੇ ਸਭੇ ਠੋਕਿ ਵਜਾੲੇ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Ditday Sabhay Tdoki Vajaaay ?20?
translation: All these relations have been thoroughly tested.
Love of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਮਾਪੇ ਹੇਤੁ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਹੇਤੁ ਸੁਚੇਤ ਸਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maapay Haytu N Pujanee Satigur Haytu Souchayt Sahaaee.
translation: Love of parents cannot be equal to the love of the true Guru, the bestower of consciousness.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹ ਵਿਸਾਹ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਾਹੁ ਅਥਾਹੁ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saah Visaah N Pujanee Satigur Saahu Adaahu Samaaee.
translation: Trust in the bankers cannot match the reliance upon the true Guru who has boundless capacity.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਸਚਾ ਸਾੲੀਂ
transliteration: Saahib Tuli N Saahibee Satigur Saahib Sachaa Saaeen.
translation: Of none's lordship is equal to the Lordship of true Guru. That true Guru is the real master.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਤੇ ਦਾਤਿ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦਾਤਾ ਸਚੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Daatay Daati N Pujanee Satigur Daataa Sachu Drirhaaee.
translation: The charities given by others cannot be equal to the charities bestowed by the true Guru because the true Guru bestows steadfastness in the truth.

gurmukhi: ਵੈਦ ਨ ਪੁਜਨਿ ਵੈਦਗੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਰੋਗ ਮਿਟਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vaid N Pujani Vaidagee Satigur Haoumai Rog Mitaaee.
translation: The treatment of the physicians cannot reach the true physician's treatment because the true Guru cures the disease of egoism.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਨ ਸੇਵ ਤੁਲ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵ ਸਦਾ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv N Sayv Tuli Satigur Sayv Sadaa Soukhadaaee.
translation: Worship of gods and goddesses is also not equal to the constant pleasure-giving worship of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਰ ਰਤਨ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਿ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saair Ratan N Pujanee Saadhasangati Guri Sabadu Soubhaaee.
translation: Even jewels of ocean cannot be equated with the holy congregation because the holy congregation is adorned by the word of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ॥੨੧॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Vadee Vadiaaee ?21?39?ounataalee?
translation: Ineffable is the story o, the grandeur of the true Guru; his glory is great.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਨ ਬਰਨ ਬਹੁ ਬਰਨ ਗੋਬੰਸ ਜੈਸੇ ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਬਰਨ ਦੁਹੇ ਦੂਧ ਜਗ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Baran Baran Bahu Baran Gobans Jaisay , Ayk Hee Baran Duhay Doodh Jag Jaaneeai ?
translation: Just as the cows are of many breeds and colours, yet the whole world knows that they all yield milk of the same colour.

gurmukhi: ਅਨਿਕ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰ ਫਲ ਫੂਲ ਕੈ ਬਨਾਸਪਤੀ ੲੇਕੈ ਰੂਪ ਅਗਨਿ ਸਰਬ ਮੈ ਸਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Anik Prakaar Dhal Dhool Kai Banaasapatee , Aykai Roop Agani Sarab Mai Samaaneeai ?
translation: There are many species of fruit and flower trees but all carry the same latent fire in them.

gurmukhi: ਚਤੁਰ ਬਰਨ ਪਾਨ ਚੂਨਾ ਅੳੁ ਸੁਪਾਰੀ ਕਾਥਾ ਅਾਪਾ ਖੋੲਿ ਮਿਲਤ ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਠਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Chatur Baran Paan Choonaa Au Soupaaree Kaadaa , Aapaa Khoi Milat Anoop Roop Tthaaneeai ?
translation: Four different colours-beetle leaf, Supari (beetle nut), Kattha (extract of the bark of accacia) and lime shed their own colour and merge in each other in a Paan and make beautiful red colour.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਗਨ ਮੈ ਲੋਗਾਚਾਰ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ੳੁਨਮਨ ੳੁਨਮਾਨੀਅੈ ॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Logan Mai Logaachaar Gurmukhi Aykankaara , Sabad Surati Ounaman Ounamaaneeai ?39?
translation: Similarly the Guru-conscious person (Gurmukh) renounces various worldly pleasures and adopts one colour of the formless God. And because of the blessings of his Guru who has taught him to unite with the divine word and his mind, he achieves higher spiritu
